column4: hey folks, I recently changed from 8.10 to 8.04 on my laptop, before changing I backed up my ~/ with tar zcvf backup.tar.gz ./ after the change I decompressed this again. Now I get Invalid MIT-MAGIC-COOKIE-1 keyError: cannot open display: :0.0 when I attempt to run a GUI program
any ideas what might be causing this?
I attempted to remove .Xauthority, and simply get Error: cannot open display: :0.0 after that.
messed up permissions... I assume
I wonder where though, since it's the same user account.
any program?
any gui, shell works fine from what I can tell.
i thought we were talking about X forwarding...
nope, this is local, after I moved my home back.
now I just have to find out what file is causing the fight, and fix that, I don't want ot just remove everything
maybe ~/.Xauthority ?
I think that's it, becuase when I remove it then I just get a display issue.
try removing  ~/.Xauthority
tried that already, but I've got a thought, one sec.
that was it, I just needed to restart X, now everything seems to be fine... at least for now.
silly me for not thinking of that earlier.
was it a downgrade?
yes and no, technically when you go from 8.10 to 8.04 it's a downgrade, but this was not done through apt, I did a clean reinstall to 8.04
ok... clean install... got it
I need 8.04 for it's OpenVZ support unfortunately.
faster
just remove windows
tm1: iptable rules don't survive a reboot
good point, that too
